intro: Harnieria dimorphocarpa, commonly known as the two-formed fruit harnieria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Harnieria dimorphocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to dry conditions.
